text: The earlier studies on the germicidal efficacy of far UVC light 13 , 15 - 18 were performed exposing bacteria irradiated on a surface or in suspension . In that a major pathway for the spread of influenza A is aerosol transmission 3 , we investigate for the first time the efficacy of far - UVC 222 - nm light for inactivating airborne viruses carried by aerosols - with the goal of providing a potentially safe alternative to conventional 254 - nm germicidal lamps to inactivate airborne microbes .
